questions.question: What is one key purpose of action instructions when creating a custom agent action in Agentforce?
options: Action instructions help the reasoning engine decide which action to use.
Action instructions define the temperature of the large language model (LLM) powering the Reasoning Engine.
Action instructions tell the user how to call this action in a conversation.
questions.explanation: Action instructions guide the Reasoning Engine about when and how to invoke a specific action. They help the LLM correctly map user intent to the appropriate action. They do not control model temperature or instruct end users.

questions.question: An account manager wants a snapshot of key data points from accounts, contacts, leads, and opportunities in Salesforce. Which feature provides this?
options: Sales Summaries
Sales Insight Summary
Work Summaries
questions.explanation: Sales Insight Summary aggregates key data points from accounts, contacts, leads, and opportunities into a unified view for sales readiness. Sales Summaries and Work Summaries do not provide this holistic snapshot.

questions.question: After provisioning Data Cloud, which step must an AI Specialist take so that Northern Trail Outfitters (NTO) can enable the Einstein Trust Layer?
options: Turn on Agent.
Turn on Einstein Generative AI.
Turn on Prompt Builder.
questions.explanation: Einstein Trust Layer requires Einstein Generative AI to be enabled. Agent and Prompt Builder do not activate Trust Layer capabilities.

questions.question: A data scientist needs to manage models in Einstein Studio and create prompt templates in Prompt Builder. Which permission sets should be assigned?
options: Prompt Template Manager and Prompt Template User
Data Cloud Admin and Prompt Template Manager
Prompt Template User and Data Cloud Admin
questions.explanation: Data Cloud Admin provides model management access for Einstein Studio, while Prompt Template Manager (interpreted as admin-level Prompt Builder access) allows template creation. Other options lack necessary admin-level permissions.

questions.question: An Agentforce Specialist needs to create a prompt template that extracts the customer's name, phone number, and case number from a block of text. How should the Specialist structure the prompt to ensure the LLM doesn't include extra conversation or text?
options: Ask the LLM to extract and only output the important information in the text.
Use well-defined output instructions and provide desired output examples.
Ensure in the prompt that the LLM has been told to only use name value pairs in the response.
questions.explanation: Best practice is to use clear output formatting instructions and examples. This ensures the LLM returns only structured data without extra text.

questions.question: Universal Containers wants its AI agent to answer customer questions with precise and up-to-date information. How does an Agentforce Data Library simplify and enable this?
options: It automates the ingestion, taxonomical classification and storage of knowledge for precision keyword search retrieval.
It automates the ingestion, indexing of data, and creates a default retriever to ground prompts and agents with relevant information.
It automates the ingestion and OCR processing of any PDF, indexing them for SQL query retrieval.
questions.explanation: Agentforce Data Libraries automate ingestion, indexing, and creation of retrievers to ground AI responses with structured and relevant information.

questions.question: A customer service representative needs to cancel flights and review Knowledge articles about canceling and rebooking. Which Agentforce capability helps the representative accomplish this?
options: Invoke a flow which makes a call to external data to create a Knowledge article.
Execute tasks based on available actions, answering questions using information from accessible Knowledge articles.
Generate Knowledge article based off the prompts that the agent enters.
questions.explanation: Agentforce can execute tasks (cancel flights) while grounding responses in existing Knowledge articles, enabling guided assistance.

questions.question: An Agentforce Specialist created a Field Generation prompt template. What should they do to expose the template to the user?
options: Use a screen flow to associate the Field Generation prompt template.
Associate the template with the form field on the Lightning page.
Call a template using an autolaunched flow.
questions.explanation: Field Generation templates must be attached directly to a Lightning Record Page field to expose the 'Generate' button to users.

questions.question: Coral Cloud Resorts needs a deterministic triage process so high severity requests escalate to a human and lower severity ones create support cases. Which approach is best?
options: Write IF/THEN/ELSE logic in Topic Instructions.
Use absolute keywords like 'Always' and 'Never' in Topic Instructions.
Create a custom variable severityLevel populated by a Triage action, and use filters so actions run based on severity.
questions.explanation: Deterministic triage requires variables and filters, not natural language instructions. severityLevel ensures consistent and predictable logic.

questions.question: UC wants a no-code solution that summarizes purchases, product interest from Data Cloud, and past interactions. Which approach should the Specialist recommend?
options: Use a prompt template grounded on CRM and Data Cloud data using the standard foundation model.
Fine-tune the standard foundational model due to the complexity of the data.
Deploy UC's own custom foundational model on this data first.
questions.explanation: Prompt Builder with grounding on CRM + Data Cloud provides no-code summaries. Fine-tuning or custom models require coding and are unnecessary.

questions.question:
Universal Containers (UC) is using Einstein Generative AI to generate an account summary. UC aims to ensure the content is safe and inclusive, utilizing the Einstein Trust Layer's toxicity scoring to assess the content's safety level.

In the score of 1 indicate?
options: The response is the least toxic Einstein Generative AI Toxicity Scoring system, what does a toxicity category.
The response is not toxic.
The response is the most toxic.
questions.explanation:
Einstein Trust Layer’s Toxicity Scoring categorizes content on a scale of 0 to 1, where 1 indicates the highest level of toxicity (e.g., harmful, biased, or inappropriate language). This scoring helps organizations filter unsafe AI-generated content. A score of 1 triggers mitigation actions, such as blocking the response or alerting administrators.

A score of 0 would indicate no toxicity (B is incorrect).

The scoring system does not use "least toxic" as a category (A is misleading).

questions.question:
Universal Containers (UC) wants to improve the productivity of its sales team with generative AI technology. However, UC is concerned that public AI virtual assistants lack adequate company data to general useful responses.

Which solution should UC consider?
options: fine-tune the Einstein AI model with CBM data.
Build Al model with Einstein discovery and deploy to sales users.
Enable Agentforce and deploy to sales users.

questions.question:
An Agentforce Specialist is creating a prompt template to assist support reps in drafting responses to customer complaints.

To ensure the responses are empathetic and helpful, what is a key element to include in the prompt template?
options: A direct instruction to the large language model (LLM) to role-play as a character
A list of keywords related to customer complaints
The entire history of the customer's previous interactions with the company
questions.explanation: Role-playing instructions ensure empathy and tone, aligning with Salesforce prompt design best practices. Keywords alone don't guide tone, and full history overloads the prompt.

questions.question:
An Agentforce is setting up a new org and needs to ensure that users can create and execute prompt templates. The Agentforce Specialist is unsure which roles are necessary for these tasks.

Which permission sets should the Agentforce Specialist assign to users who need to create and execute prompt templates?
options: Prompt Template Manager for creating templates and Data Cloud Admin for executing templates
Prompt Template Manager for creating templates and Prompt Template User for executing templates
Data Cloud Admin for creating templates and Prompt Template User for executing templates
questions.explanation: Prompt Template Manager is required to create templates, and Prompt Template User is required to execute them. Data Cloud Admin is unrelated to prompt creation/execution.

questions.question:
An Agentforce Specialist at Universal Containers (UC) is building with no-code tools only. They have many small accounts that are only touched periodically by a specialized sales team, and UC wants to maximize the sales operations team's time, UC wants to help prep the sales team for calls by:

* Summarizing past purchases

* Displaying products the contact has shown interest in (with data captured via Data Cloud)

* Providing a recap of past email and phone conversations that have transcripts

Which approach should the Agentforce Specialist recommend to achieve this goal?
options: Deploy UC's own custom foundational model on this data first.
Fine-tune the standard foundational model due to the complexity of the data.
Use a prompt template grounded on CRM and Data Cloud data using standard foundation models.
questions.explanation: Standard foundation models with grounded prompt templates allow summarizing CRM + Data Cloud data without custom models or fine-tuning.

questions.question:
Universal Containers (UC) has a legacy system that needs to integrate with Salesforce. UC wishes to create a digest of account action plans using the generative API feature.

Which API service should UC use to meet this requirement?
options: REST API
Metadata API
SOAP API
questions.explanation: REST API supports generative content creation and modern integrations. Metadata API is for metadata changes, and SOAP is less suitable here.

questions.question:
Universal Containers (UC) currently tracks Leads with a custom object. UC is preparing to implement the Sales Development Representative (SDR) Agent.

Which consideration should UC keep in mind?
options: Agentforce SDR only works with the standard Lead object.
Agentforce SDR only works on Opportunities.
Agentforce SDR only supports custom objects associated with Accounts.
questions.explanation: SDR Agent is built specifically for the standard Lead object. It cannot operate on custom lead objects or opportunities.

questions.question:
The marketing team at Universal Containers is looking for a way personalize emails based on customer behavior, preferences, and purchase history.

Why should the team use Agent as the solution?
options: To generate relevant content when engaging with each customer
To analyze past campaign performance
To send automated emails to all customers
questions.explanation: Agent generates personalized content using customer behavior, preferences, and history—perfect for tailored emails.

questions.question:
Universal Containers has a custom Agent action calling a flow to retrieve the real-time status of an order from the order fulfillment system.

For the given flow, what should the Agentforce Specialist consider about the running user's data access?
options: The flow must have the "with sharing" permission selected m the advanced settings for the permissions, field-level security, and sharing settings to be respected.

The custom action adheres to the permissions, held-level security, and sharing settings configured in the flow.
.
The Agent will always run flows in system mode so the running user's data access will not affect the data returned.
questions.explanation: Flows invoked by Agent actions run in system mode unless configured otherwise, so running user permissions do not restrict data returned.

questions.question:
An Agentforce configured Data Masking within the Einstein Trust Layer.

How should the Agentforce Specialist begin validating that the correct fields are being masked?
options: Use a Flow-based resource in Prompt Builder to debug the fields’ merge values using Flow Debugger.
Request the Einstein Generative AI Audit Data from the Security section of the Setup menu.
Enable the collection and storage of Einstein Generative AI Audit Data on the Einstein Feedback setup page.
questions.explanation: Validation begins by enabling the storage of Einstein Generative AI Audit Data. This allows reviewing what fields were masked in generated content.

questions.question:
Universal Containers wants to assign agents to improve department efficiency.

Which configuration ensures the right tasks are handled by the right agents?
options: SDR Agent for lead qualification, Service Agent for support tickets, Employee Agent for HR requests
Sales Coach Agent for lead and service Agent for HR requests, and Support tickets to ensure cases are available
One Service Agent to efficiently handle each of these scenarios, which reduces the number of agent types needed for support
questions.explanation: According to the AgentForce Product Overview and Deployment Guide, Salesforce recommends using purpose-built agents to maximize efficiency across departments...

questions.question:
Universal Containers wants to test agents while preserving real data and isolating from production.

Which environment should the company use with Testing Center?
options: Use personal developer orgs unrepresentative of production data,
Use production org directly with test assertions.
Use sandbox environments replicated from production for safe testing,
questions.explanation: The AgentForce Testing Center Implementation Guide specifies that organizations should perform all structured and regression testing in a sandbox environment replicated from production...

questions.question: How is Data Cloud leveraged by the Answer Questions with Knowledge action in Agentforce?
options: Data Cloud is not required; the articles can be accessed directly from the CRM by the agent.
Data Cloud stores and manages the Indexed Knowledge articles.
Data Cloud provides the real-time data streams that update the Knowledge articles.
questions.explanation: The Answer Questions with Knowledge action in Agentforce leverages Salesforce Data Cloud to store, manage, and index Knowledge articles used for AI-powered responses...

questions.question: What is the main purpose of Prompt Builder?
options: A tool for developers to use in Visual Studio Code that creates prompts for Apex programming, assisting developers in writing code more efficiently.
A tool that enables companies to create reusable prompts for large language models (LLMs), bringing generative AI responses to their flow of work
A tool within Salesforce offering real-time Al-powered suggestions and guidance to users, Improving productivity and decision-making.
questions.explanation: Prompt Builder is designed to help organizations create and configure reusable prompts for large language models (LLMs)...

questions.question: Which feature in the Einstein Trust Layer helps to minimize the risks of jailbreaking and prompt injection attacks?
options: Secure Data Retrieval and Grounding
Data Masking
Prompt Defense
questions.explanation: Prompt Defense guards against malicious prompts or injection attacks, reducing jailbreak and manipulation risks...

questions.question:
Universal Containers (UC) plans to implement prompt templates that utilize the standard foundation models.

What should UC consider when building prompt templates in Prompt Builder?
options: Include multiple-choice questions within the prompt to test the LLM’s understanding of the context.
Ask it to role-play as a character in the prompt template to provide more context to the LL
Train LLM with data using different writing styles including word choice, intensifiers, emojis, and punctuation.
questions.explanation: Role-playing enhances context for standard models, a recommended technique in Prompt Builder...

questions.question:
Universal Containers has a strict change management process that requires all possible configuration to be completed in a sandbox which will be deployed to production. The Agentforce Specialist is tasked with setting up Work Summaries for Enhanced Messaging...

Which other configuration steps should the Agentforce Specialist take in the sandbox that can be deployed to the production org?
options: create custom fields to store Issue, Resolution, and Summary; create a Quick Action that updates these fields: add the Wrap Up component to the Messaging Session record paae layout: and create Permission Set Assignments for the intended Agents.

From the Epstein setup menu, select Turn on Einstein: create custom fields to store Issue, Resolution, and Summary: create a Quick Action that updates these fields: and add the wrap up componert to the Messaging session record page layout.
Create custom fields to store issue, Resolution, and Summary; create a Quick Action that updates these fields: and ado the Wrap up component to the Messaging session record page lavcut.
questions.explanation: Custom fields, quick actions, and page layout changes are deployable metadata; permission set assignments and 'turn on Einstein' are not...

questions.question:
Universal Containers is indexing millions of product manuals where users may ask both structured queries (model numbers) and natural language questions (for example, “How do I reset my device?”).

Which retrieval approach should the company use?
options: Use keyword search only, since model numbers dominate queries.
Use semantic search only, as natural language is always preferred.
Use hybrid search to combine keyword precision with semantic flexibility.
questions.explanation: Hybrid search combines the precision of keyword retrieval with semantic flexibility, ideal for mixed structured and unstructured queries...

questions.question: How does Secure Data Retrieval ensure that only authorized users can access necessary Salesforce data for dynamic grounding?
options: Retrieves Salesforce data based on the 'Run As" users permissions.
Retrieves Salesforce data based on the user’s permissions executing the prompt.
Retrieves Salesforces data based on the Prompt template's object permissions.
questions.explanation: Secure Data Retrieval enforces CRUD/FLS using the permissions of the user executing the prompt, ensuring compliance...

questions.question: When using a prompt template, what should an Agentforce Specialist consider with their grounding data and chosen model?
options: Review the token limit in the Einstein Trust Layer.
Ensure queries used for grounding employ offset so the token limits of models are not exceeded.
Review the model limitation in Prompt Builder versus the grounding data size.
questions.explanation: LLMs have fixed token limits; grounding data + prompt must fit within model limits. Prompt Builder specialists must verify this...

questions.question:
An Agentforce turned on Einstein Generative AI in Setup. Now, the Agentforce Specialist would like to create custom prompt templates in Prompt Builder. However, they cannot access Prompt Builder in the Setup menu.

What is causing the problem?
options: The Prompt Template User permission set was not assigned correctly.
The Prompt Template Manager permission set was not assigned correctly.
The large language model (LLM) was not configured correctly in Data Cloud.
questions.explanation: The Prompt Template Manager permission set is required to access and create prompt templates in Prompt Builder. Without it, Prompt Builder will not appear in Setup even if Einstein Generative AI is enabled.

questions.question:
When a verified customer in a help center says, “I want to upgrade my service plan,” an AI agent needs to complete the following tasks:

Verify identity and entitlement.
Create a new quote.
Calculate a prorated upgrade amount.
Escalate to an Account Executive (AE) only if the reorder exceeds USD 25,000.

Which type of agent should an AgentForce Specialist build to support this use case?
options: Service Agent to resolve the case end-to-end and create a new opportunity for the sales team
Sales Agent to handle the upsell and large-deal escalation
Employee Agent to orchestrate internal logistics and finance
questions.explanation: This is a revenue-generating process involving quoting, proration, and escalation thresholds. AgentForce documentation confirms a Sales Agent is designed for upsell, quoting, and AE escalation workflows.

questions.question:
Cloud Kicks (CK) recently finished the development of a new prompt template that uses its own large language model (LLM). CK is deploying a prompt template from a sandbox to a production org, and is receiving an error. When trying to deploy the change set, CK is getting an error related to the LLM used in the prompt template.

What is the cause of the error?
options: The prompt does not specify that it is a custom LL
BYOLLM is not yet supported for in prompt templates in production.
The name of the LLM does not match in sandbox and production.
questions.explanation: Prompt templates reference an LLM by name and ID. If the LLM configuration does not exist or is named differently in production, the change set fails. The LLM must match across environments.

questions.question: What is an Agentforce Specialist able to do when the ‘Enrich event logs with conversation data’ setting in the Agentforce configuration is enabled?
options: View the user click path that led to each agent action.
View session data including user input and agent responses for sessions.
Generate details reports on all agent conversations over any time period.
questions.explanation: Enabling conversation data enrichment appends user inputs and agent responses to event logs. It does not track click paths or generate aggregate reports.

questions.question:
Universal Containers implemented Agent for its users.

One user complains that Agent is not deleting activities from the past 7 days.

What is the reason for this issue?
options: Agent Delete Record Action permission is not associated to the user.
Agent does not have the permission to delete the user's records.
Agent does not support the Delete Record action.
questions.explanation: Agent cannot delete records. It supports create, retrieve, and update actions, but delete operations are not supported.

questions.question:
Universal Containers wants to keep retrieval accurate as product documentation changes frequently.

Which approach should the company implement?
options: Leave embedding unchanged even if content is updated.
Rebuild the search index.
Manually delete the stale data chunks.
questions.explanation: When documentation changes, embeddings become outdated. Rebuilding the search index ensures all chunks and embeddings reflect current content.

questions.question:
Universal Containers wants to allow its service agents to query the current fulfillment status of an order with natural language. There is an existing auto launched flow to query the information from Oracle ERP.

How should An Agentforce apply the power of conversational AI to this use case?
options: Create a Flex prompt template in Prompt Builder.
Create a custom copilot action which calls a flow.
Configure the Integration Flow Standard Action in Agent.
questions.explanation: A custom copilot action can call the existing flow, allowing natural language queries to retrieve ERP data through the flow.

questions.question: In addition to Recipient and Sender, which object should An Agentforce utilize for inserting merge fields into a Sales email template prompt?
options: Recipient Opportunities
Recipient Account
User Organization
questions.explanation: Recipient Account provides company-level details useful in sales emails. Recipient Opportunities may be multiple, and User Organization is not typically used in email personalization.

questions.question:
Universal Containers’ administrator has developed a new agent in a sandbox environment and now wants to deploy it to production.

What should the administrator do to deploy an agent?
options: Manually recreate the agent configuration, topics, and actions in production because change sets cannot be used,
Export agent components as JSON files and manually import them inte production using the Metadata AP
Create an outbound change set with all the necessary agent components, then upload to production.
questions.explanation: Agents, topics, prompt templates, flows, and permissions can be deployed using change sets. This is the recommended Salesforce method.

questions.question:
An Agentforce Service Agent, who has been successfully assisting customers with service requests in Salesforce, is now unable to help customers with issues related to a new product replacement process. The company recently implemented a custom Product Replacement object.

Which Agentforce Agent User change must be implemented to address this issue?
options: The permission set group assigned to the Agent User needs to grant access to the Product Replacement flow.
The permission set assigned to the Agent User needs Read access to the custom Product Replacement object.
The profile assigned to the Agentforce Agent User needs AI training permission to the custom Product Replacement object.
questions.explanation: The agent cannot interact with the Product Replacement process without Read access to the custom object. Object permissions must be granted through the permission set.

questions.question: What does it mean when a prompt template version is described as immutable?
options: Only the latest version of a template can be activated.
Every modification on a template will be saved as a new version automatically.
Prompt template version is activated; no further changes can be saved to that version.
questions.explanation: When a prompt template version is immutable, it means that once the version is activated, it cannot be edited or modified. This ensures consistency in production environments.

questions.question:
Universal Containers (UC) wants to enable its sales team to use AI to suggest recommended products from its catalog.

Which type of prompt template should UC use?
options: Record summary prompt template
Email generation prompt template
Flex prompt template
questions.explanation: Flex prompt templates allow custom inputs and dynamic logic, making them ideal for generating product recommendations from a catalog.

questions.question:
Universal Containers’ data science team is hosting a generative large language model (LLM) on Amazon Web Services (AWS).

What should the team use to access externally-hosted models in the Salesforce Platform?
options: Model Builder
App Builder
Copilot Builder
questions.explanation: Model Builder is used to integrate external AI models, such as LLMs hosted on AWS, into Salesforce.

questions.question:
Universal Containers (UC) wants to deploy an Agentforce Service Agent to support customers via a web experience. UC uses a Digital Experience site and wants to enable messaging for logged-in users. The customer needs to pass the membership number to the agent for which a pre-chat variable is available.

What is a required step to connect the agent to the Digital Experience site using Messaging for In-App and Web?
options: Configure a messaging Lightning web component using standard or custom Lightning Type for Agentforce.
Create an Omni-Channel flow that routes messages to the agent.
Configure MuleSoft to establish a secure API tunnel between the agent and the Digital Experience site.
questions.explanation: Messaging for In-App and Web requires an Omni-Channel Flow that routes MessagingSession records to the Agentforce Service Agent.

questions.question:
Universal Containers implements Custom Agent Actions to enhance its customer service operations. The development team needs to understand the core components of a Custom Agent Action.

What should the development team review to identify one of the core components?
options: Action Triggers
Instructions
Output Types
questions.explanation: Instructions are a core component of Custom Agent Actions and tell the AI how and when to execute the action.

questions.question:
A Service Agent at Universal Containers (UC) is designed to help customers resolve issues by searching against knowledge articles. Knowledge articles have PDF attachments. The agent summarizes articles but is unaware of PDF contents.

How should an Agentforce Specialist configure the Data Cloud search index to include attached file content?
options: Increase article chunk size and token limits for Knowledge indexing so larger contexts capture attachment references.
Enable 'Include Related Attachments’ for Knowledge-- kav and map the ContentDocumentLink unstructured data model object (UDMO).
Use Data Cloud's ‘Include Attachments’ option and select the ContentDocumentVersion unstructured data model object (UDMO).
questions.explanation: To include PDF content, 'Include Attachments' must be enabled and the ContentDocumentVersion UDMO mapped so attachment text is indexed.

questions.question:
Coral Cloud Resorts is uploading thousands of new HTML knowledge article files for a resort launch.

To ensure Agentforce retrieves accurate responses quickly, which chunking strategy should be used?
options: Semantic-based passage extraction
Conversation-based chunking
Section-aware chunking
questions.explanation: Section-aware chunking preserves headings and structure in HTML docs, producing more accurate retrieval.

questions.question:
Universal Containers (UC) is setting up a new Agentforce Service Agent. The company has sensitive medical product research stored internally and wants to ensure the agent cannot access it.

What should UC do?
options: Assign the Agentforce Service Agent user the lowest possible role in the organization's hierarchy to block access.
Disable the Agentforce Service Agent's ability to use any Salesforce custom object or related fields.
Follow the principle of least privilege and avoid granting permission to view the Medical Product object or related
questions.explanation: Least privilege means simply not granting access to the sensitive Medical Product object in the permission set group.

questions.question:
A service agent is looking at a custom object storing travel information. A weather alert requires canceling flights and the agent needs to review Knowledge articles about canceling/rebooking flights.

Which Agent capability helps the agent accomplish this?
options: Execute tasks based on available actions, answering questions using information from accessible Knowledge articles.
Invoke a flow which makes a call to external data to create a Knowledge article.
Generate a Knowledge article based off the prompts that the agent enters to create steps to cancel flights.
questions.explanation: The scenario states the correct answer is generating a Knowledge article based on prompts, per the text you provided.

questions.question:
Universal Containers (UC) is implementing generative AI and wants to leverage a prompt template to provide personalized product recommendations to website visitors based on browsing history.

Which initial step should UC take to ensure the chatbot can deliver accurate recommendations?
options: Design universal product recommendations.
Write a response script for the chatbot.
Collect and analyze browsing data.
questions.explanation: Browsing data is required so the AI can generate personalized recommendations; without this data, personalization is impossible.
